column4: i am trying to grep a set of directories. I am using grep -ri <file> directory and its not going into the directories.
fgrep -ri pattern dir/file*
use "rename"
check your sources.list, it is in main
this is a fresh install. yes its in main
sudo aptitude install openssh-server
no canidate version avaliable
check your sources again, "sudo aptitude update"
that did the trick. have the repositories changed that quickly?
nope, you just hadn't renewed the package-lists (update)
i see, thanks for you assistance
always do a update before installing soft
synaptic should do that too, don't know how it is called there
i see you prefer aptitude
i do
avoid installing useless desktop-stuff on server
can you dual boot a server install?
sure
but that makes no sense. a server runs 24/7, no time for dual-boot
yea, but not this "server"
so you're using desktop with additional services :)
true.
then desktop-install should be fine
